abstract.text: The payload you use to configure web content filters.

inlineContent.text: An array of dictionaries that define the pages that the user can bookmark or visit. Use when
, the system enables automatic filtering. Use when
A globally unique identifier for this content filter configuration. The content filter processes network traffic for managed apps with the same
in their app attributes. Use when
An array of URLs that are inaccessible. Use when
, the system enables filtering WebKit traffic. Use when
The bundle identifier string of the filter data provider system extension. This string identifies the filter data provider when the filter starts running. Required if

The designated requirement string that the system embeds in the code signature of the filter data provider system extension. This string identifies the filter data provider when the filter starts running. Required if
The system uses this value to derive the relative order of content filters. Filters with a grade of
see network traffic before filters with a grade of
. However, the system doesn’t define the order of filters within a grade.
, the system enables filtering network packets. Use when
The bundle identifier string of the filter packet provider system extension. This string identifies the filter packet provider when the filter starts running. Required if

The designated requirement string that the system embeds in the code signature of the filter packet provider system extension. This string identifies the filter packet provider when the filter starts running. Required if
, enables the filtering of socket traffic. Use when
The type of filter, built-in or plug-in. In macOS, the system only supports the plug-in value.
The organization string to pass to the third-party plug-in. Use when
The password for the service. Use when
The UUID of the certificate payload within the same profile that the system uses to authenticate the user. Use when
An array or URLs that are accessible whether or not the automatic filter allows access. Use when
The bundle ID of the plug-in that provides filtering service. Required when
. Otherwise, it ignores this value. Consult your filtering solution vendor to determine what to specify for this value. Required when
The server address, which may be the IP address, hostname, or URL. Use when
The display name for this filtering configuration. Required when
The user name for the service. Use when
The custom dictionary that the filtering service plug-in needs. Use when

The system matches URLs using string-based matching. A URL matches an allow list, deny list, or permitted list pattern if the exact characters of the pattern appear as a substring of the URL requested in the web browser. For example, if the system doesn’t allow
The system matches list entries that terminate with a
character explicitly; if the system blocks or allows
subdomain prefix if present, so if the system doesn’t allow
All filtering options are active simultaneously. The system only permits URLs and sites that pass all rules.

abstract.text: The profile you use to configure web clips on the device.
The payload you use to configure web content filters.
The bookmark in the allow list of the web content filter.
A custom dictionary for the filtering service plug-in.
The bookmark in the allow list of the web content filter.
